Fed officials reported an “extraordinary amount of uncertainty and considerable risks to economic activity in the medium term.” Interest rates are hovering near zero, and they’ll stay near zero.</span>

The Nasdaq, with its focus on tech stocks, is at a </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/0472987052e2266d02a9f19670cf9838?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three-month high</a></span><span>.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMBLING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/20/casinos-across-country-reopening-look-different?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The House Always Wins...Except Against a Global Pandemic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Casino reopening" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDQ0L2Nhc2lub19yZW9wZW5pbmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The gambling industry is working on a patchwork plan to reopen after the coronavirus and social distancing measures forced casino closures and kept away patrons. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It was ugly</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At one point this year, all 989 commercial and tribal casinos in the U.S. were <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/gamblers-drive-hours-and-wait-in-lines-as-casinos-reopen-amid-coronavirus-11589886610?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down</a>. All of them. It's devastated Vegas, but those closures were also a really bad beat for smaller gambling markets.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Adjusted gaming revenue in north Mississippi fell 36% from February to March, but that doesn't take in the full extent of the damage.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One region in Mississippi closed seven casinos, leaving a third of employed residents in Tunica County without work. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the economic reverberations of casino shutdowns ringing in their ears, officials are eager to move forward with reopenings...with extreme caution:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“A casino is considered high-risk in terms of contact intensity, volume, and potential for visitors congregating in large groups,” a spokesman for New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell told the WSJ.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So when will they reopen?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s kind of a crapshoot. Casinos in the three biggest markets—Nevada, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey—remain closed. But down south…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Louisiana started to open some casinos on Monday—with a 25% occupancy limit.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In Mississippi, they can reopen starting today, with a 50% cap. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like many other industries, casino operators are faced with a “new normal,” and are experimenting with ways to lure COVID-wary guests back to the slots. Handwashing stations and contact tracing are in while promotional stalwarts like <a href="https://www.reviewjournal.com/entertainment/food/buffets-in-las-vegas-casinos-might-have-had-their-day-2031935/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all-you-can-eat buffets</a> might be on their way out. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I think it’s going to be a long time before customers are willing to eat at buffets, where they’re grabbing food from pans that other people have been grabbing food from,” Tom Reeg, CEO of Eldorado Resorts, told the Las Vegas Review-Journal. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The house is betting cooped up gamblers will return, but with a <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Sports/wireStory/shut-virus-gamblers-turning-online-betting-69650789?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big uptick in online betting</a> and significant health and safety concerns, it might not have the edge this time. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/20/lowes-beats-home-depot-sales-surge?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Lowe’s Nailed Earnings
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Hammer flipping" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/B7wuyKVTYe6pG/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Hammer flipping" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/B7wuyKVTYe6pG/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Edward vs. Jacob, CHD vs. Barstool, a creative writing degree vs. our parents' expectations—intense rivalries, sure, but no match for the clash of the home improvement titans: Lowe’s and Home Depot. That old feud got a jolt this week when both reported earnings. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> Lowe’s has <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/personal-finance/070715/home-depot-vs-lowes-home-improvement-battle.asp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">played second fiddle</a> to Home Depot in both market capitalization and revenue, despite being in business 32 years longer and having more store locations.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But Lowe’s is riding high</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With people focused on improving the homes they were stuck in, the retailer <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/20/lowes-low-earnings-q1-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beat Q1 expectations</a> across the plywood board:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Same-store sales were up 11%, compared to 6% for Home Depot.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Net income increased by 28% and gross revenue was up 11%.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened?</strong> Lowe’s has fewer stores located in cities, which helped it weather the coronavirus storm better than its rival. And it capitalized on the shift to curbside pickup, recording an 80% increase in online sales. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check: </strong>The <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/economy-could-spoil-home-improvement-party-11589992635?mod=business_minor_pos10&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">uncertain future</a> of the housing market means gains in the home improvement sector might be short-lived.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INDUSTRIALS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/20/midland-mi-area-inundated-dow?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Michigan Flooding Breaches Dow Plant
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Flooding in Michigan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDQzL2Zsb29kaW5nX2luX21pY2hpZ2FuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gregory Shamus/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Midland region of Michigan <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/20/climate/michigan-dam-dow-chemical-superfund.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was inundated</a> with flooding that reached nine feet high. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As of yesterday evening, the county has evacuated 1,000 people and the city of Midland plans to remove 10,000 more. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s also bad for biz. </strong>Located in that region is a cluster of production facilities belonging to Dow, a huge chemicals company, and other industrial firms. Dow said it has activated a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-20/dow-activates-emergency-operations-after-dam-breaks-in-michigan?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flood preparedness plan</a>, and that runoff ponds had filled with floodwaters. It also <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-dow-floods/dow-shuts-midland-operations-after-flood-waters-sweep-in-idUSKBN22W2OR?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down</a> its HQ in Midland. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Those waters could reach Dow’s storage tanks and expose the surrounding area to its chemicals. They could also stir up pollution from a Superfund site (a contaminated area the EPA has designated for cleanup) downriver from the compound. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>After two days of heavy rain, water from Lake Wixom broke through a dam on Tuesday evening, and then another later that night. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>We’ve been trying to limit our “stone cold bummer” stories, but...this is one. Before the flooding, Michigan was already scrambling to face an especially severe COVID-19 outbreak.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Facebook shares climbed 6% and <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/20/facebook-shares-reach-all-time-high-after-announcing-online-shopping-feature.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">touched</a> an all-time high. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why?</strong> Having conquered the attention economy, Facebook is gunning for the exchanging products for money economy. On Tuesday, it <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/05/19/facebook-shops/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled Facebook Shops</a>, a new tool that will make it even easier for merchants to list products on Facebook and Instagram than it is to fritter away 3 ½ hours on Facebook and Instagram. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works: </strong>Brands can register on Shops to sell products through Facebook and Instagram storefronts, Stories, and ads. Third-party partners like Shopify and Woo will do the heavy lifting handling inventory, orders, and fulfillment. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The point, </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/05/20/facebook-launches-new-ecommerce-initiative-facebook-shops?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Retail Brew</a></span><span>: "Planting commerce tools in every orifice of its apps could finally train users to see Facebook as a virtual mall."</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wall Street’s reviews are in</strong>, and if Shops were a novel, analysts would call it “a stunning, incandescent tour de force.” Deutsche Bank said it could drive as much as $30 billion in revenue, while Morgan Stanley said it could make Facebook an e-comm competitor to Amazon and Google.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Rush hour in Hanoi, Vietnam, Tuesday morning. </strong>Remarkably, the country of nearly 100 million people has recorded only 324 coronavirus cases and no deaths. Nonessential businesses such as pubs, theaters, and spas are back in action.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The next step? Getting Vietnam's <a href="https://www.bangkokpost.com/business/1920824/vietnam-offers-cut-price-paradise-to-lure-local-travellers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tourism engine</a> running again: The number of visitors decreased 98% in April than a year before. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That's still better than Japan, which welcomed just 2,900 foreign visitors during the entire month of April. That's a </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-20/visitors-to-japan-slump-99-9-as-3-million-tourists-become-3-000?srnd=markets-vp&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">99.9% annual drop</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/20/quirky-new-jobs-rise-covid19s-ashes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When One Door Closes...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus pandemic obliterated what had been the best labor market in generations, but some quirky new jobs are rising from the ashes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Soft Drink Dispenser Operations Associate: </strong>As part of its guidelines for reopening, McDonald’s is advising stores place attendants at soft drink stations during peak hours, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-19/coronavirus-jobs-new-era-brings-scanners-tracers-and-sanitizers?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Bloomberg</a>. Two to three years of experience mixing Coke and Fanta strongly encouraged. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Assistant to the Regional Manager of Pandemic Containing: </strong>States are hiring thousands of <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/18/health/coronavirus-contact-tracing-jobs.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">contact tracers</a>—workers who call people who’ve been in close contact with someone who recently tested positive for COVID-19.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Junior Button Pusher: </strong>JPMorgan said it might designate workers to <a href="https://www.americanbanker.com/articles/bankers-arent-returning-to-skyscrapers-anytime-soon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">push elevator buttons</a> in its offices to prevent unnecessary contact with germy objects. The company expects offices to remain half full for the “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-19/coronavirus-jobs-new-era-brings-scanners-tracers-and-sanitizers?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">foreseeable future</a>,” per Bloomberg.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">SVP, Division of Getting Turned Up: </strong>On Monday, Sara’s Market On the Go became Los Angeles’s first liquor store on wheels, <a href="https://www.lataco.com/saras-market-on-the-go/?utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">L.A. Taco reports</a>. The owners took advantage of relaxed regulations to turn their brick-and-mortar location into a tricked-out van that can start a party in any neighborhood at any time.</p>

FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/20/brews-bookshelf-beach-reads?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzMvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every other Thursday, we'll bring you some must-have books for your summer reading list. </em></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Inside Story:</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://www.simonandschuster.com/books/Red-Card/Ken-Bensinger/9781501133909?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Red Card</em></a></span><span> by Ken Bensinger traces one of the most sensational stories of power and corruption in the 21st century: the FIFA scandal. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Econ: </strong></span><span><a href="https://www.gatesnotes.com/Books/Good-Economics-for-Hard-Times?WT.mc_id=20200518100000_SummerBooks2020_MED-media_&WT.tsrc=MEDmedia&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Good Economics for Hard Times</em></a></span><span> by Nobel Prize-winning pair Abhijit Banerjee and Esther Duflo was one of Bill Gates’s 13 summer reading recs. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">History: </strong></span><span><a href="https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/554196/the-billionaire-raj-by-james-crabtree/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Billionaire Raj</em></a></span><span><em>: A Journey Through India’s New Gilded Age</em></span><span> is James Crabtree’s exploration of the rise of India’s billionaire class, inequality, and the forces that challenge the world’s largest democracy. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Want to submit your own book recommendation? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/O2tX0X?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Share it here.</a></p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nGAMBLING \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Pandemic\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Casino reopening\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe gambling industry is working on a patchwork plan to reopen after the coronavirus and social distancing measures forced casino closures and kept away patrons. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt was ugly\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt one point this year, all 989 commercial and tribal casinos in the U.S. were \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/gamblers-drive-hours-and-wait-in-lines-as-casinos-reopen-amid-coronavirus-11589886610?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down\u003c/a\u003e. All of them. It's devastated Vegas, but those closures were also a really bad beat for smaller gambling markets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAdjusted gaming revenue in north Mississippi fell 36% from February to March, but that doesn't take in the full extent of the damage.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne region in Mississippi closed seven casinos, leaving a third of employed residents in Tunica County without work. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith the economic reverberations of casino shutdowns ringing in their ears, officials are eager to move forward with reopenings...with extreme caution:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“A casino is considered high-risk in terms of contact intensity, volume, and potential for visitors congregating in large groups,” a spokesman for New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell told the WSJ.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo when will they reopen?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s kind of a crapshoot. Casinos in the three biggest markets—Nevada, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey—remain closed. But down south…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLouisiana started to open some casinos on Monday—with a 25% occupancy limit.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn Mississippi, they can reopen starting today, with a 50% cap. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike many other industries, casino operators are faced with a “new normal,” and are experimenting with ways to lure COVID-wary guests back to the slots. Handwashing stations and contact tracing are in while promotional stalwarts like \u003ca href=\"https://www.reviewjournal.com/entertainment/food/buffets-in-las-vegas-casinos-might-have-had-their-day-2031935/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eall-you-can-eat buffets\u003c/a\u003e might be on their way out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I think it’s going to be a long time before customers are willing to eat at buffets, where they’re grabbing food from pans that other people have been grabbing food from,” Tom Reeg, CEO of Eldorado Resorts, told the Las Vegas Review-Journal. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe house is betting cooped up gamblers will return, but with a \u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Sports/wireStory/shut-virus-gamblers-turning-online-betting-69650789?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebig uptick in online betting\u003c/a\u003e and significant health and safety concerns, it might not have the edge this style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEdward vs. Jacob, CHD vs. Barstool, a creative writing degree vs. our parents' expectations—intense rivalries, sure, but no match for the clash of the home improvement titans: Lowe’s and Home Depot. That old feud got a jolt this week when both reported earnings. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e Lowe’s has \u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/articles/personal-finance/070715/home-depot-vs-lowes-home-improvement-battle.asp?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplayed second fiddle\u003c/a\u003e to Home Depot in both market capitalization and revenue, despite being in business 32 years longer and having more store locations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut Lowe’s is riding high\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith people focused on improving the homes they were stuck in, the retailer \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/20/lowes-low-earnings-q1-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeat Q1 expectations\u003c/a\u003e across the plywood board:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSame-store sales were up 11%, compared to 6% for Home Depot.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNet income increased by 28% and gross revenue was up 11%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened?\u003c/strong\u003e Lowe’s has fewer stores located in cities, which helped it weather the coronavirus storm better than its rival. And it capitalized on the shift to curbside pickup, recording an 80% increase in online sales. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check: \u003c/strong\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/economy-could-spoil-home-improvement-party-11589992635?mod=business_minor_pos10\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003euncertain future\u003c/a\u003e of the housing market means gains in the home improvement sector might be style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGregory Shamus/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Midland region of Michigan \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/20/climate/michigan-dam-dow-chemical-superfund.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas inundated\u003c/a\u003e with flooding that reached nine feet high. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs of yesterday evening, the county has evacuated 1,000 people and the city of Midland plans to remove 10,000 more. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s also bad for biz. \u003c/strong\u003eLocated in that region is a cluster of production facilities belonging to Dow, a huge chemicals company, and other industrial firms. Dow said it has activated a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-20/dow-activates-emergency-operations-after-dam-breaks-in-michigan?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eflood preparedness plan\u003c/a\u003e, and that runoff ponds had filled with floodwaters. It also \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-dow-floods/dow-shuts-midland-operations-after-flood-waters-sweep-in-idUSKBN22W2OR?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down\u003c/a\u003e its HQ in Midland. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThose waters could reach Dow’s storage tanks and expose the surrounding area to its chemicals. They could also stir up pollution from a Superfund site (a contaminated area the EPA has designated for cleanup) downriver from the compound. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter two days of heavy rain, water from Lake Wixom broke through a dam on Tuesday evening, and then another later that night. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWe’ve been trying to limit our “stone cold bummer” stories, but...this is one. Before the flooding, Michigan was already scrambling to face an especially severe COVID-19 outbreak.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
